items.title: The Phishing Attempt
items.text: Yesterday, Robert **received** a strange email. It **looked** like it **came** from his bank. The email **said**: 'Your account is blocked. Please click here to verify your identity.' Robert **didn't click** the link. Instead, he **opened** his bank app and **checked** his status. Everything **was** fine. He **realized** it **was** a phishing scam. He **didn't reply** to the email; he **forwarded** it to the bank's security department and then **deleted** it.

questions.question: What did the email ask Robert to do?
options: To click a link and verify identity
questions.explanation: The email said 'Please click here to verify your identity'.

questions.question: Did Robert click the link?
options: He asked his wife to click it
questions.explanation: The text states 'Robert didn't click the link'.

questions.question: What did he do with the email finally?
options: He forwarded it and deleted it
questions.explanation: He forwarded it to security and then deleted it.

items.title: Fraud Investigation Call
items.transcript:
Agent: Good morning, this is the Global Bank Fraud Department. Did you authorize a $900 payment to 'London Electronics' today?
Customer: No, I didn't! I'm in Madrid right now. I didn't buy anything in London.
Agent: I see. Did you lose your physical card?
Customer: No, I have it here in my wallet. Wait... I didn't see it this morning. Oh no, it's gone!
Agent: Don't worry. I blocked the card now. Did you use the card yesterday?
Customer: Yes, I used it at a restaurant. I think I left it there.

questions.explanation: The customer says 'I'm in Madrid right now'.

questions.question: Does the customer have the card?
questions.explanation: The customer realizes 'it's gone!' after checking the wallet.

questions.question: Where did the customer probably leave the card?
questions.explanation: The customer says 'I used it at a restaurant. I think I left it there'.

items.title: Secure Online Shopping
items.text: Last week, Sarah **wanted** to buy a new laptop online. She **didn't use** her main debit card. Instead, she **created** a disposable virtual card in her neobank app. She **set** a limit of $1000. She **bought** the laptop and then the app **destroyed** the card automatically. Later, a hacker **tried** to use the same card details, but the transaction **failed**. Sarah **felt** very safe with this technology.

questions.question: What kind of card did Sarah use?
What happened to the card after the purchase?
options: It was blocked by the bank
questions.explanation: The text says 'the app destroyed the card automatically'.

questions.question: Why did the hacker's attempt fail?
options: Because the card no longer existed
Because the hacker used the wrong PIN
questions.explanation: Since the card was disposable and destroyed after one use, it couldn't be used again.

items.title: Setting Spending Limits
items.transcript:
Agent: Customer service, how can I help?
Customer: Hi, I want to set a daily limit on my card. I'm worried about security.
Agent: Of course. I can do that for you. What limit do you want?
Customer: Can we set it to $500 per day?
Agent: Yes. I updated your settings now. Did you also activate the push notifications?
Customer: Yes, I did that yesterday. I receive an alert for every cent I spend now.
Agent: Perfect. That is very safe.
